text.headline: New Golf Course in Cyprus
text.text:
The new Limassol Hills Golf Resort is a joint venture between Cyprus Golf Properties and Limassol Hills Development. Current population of Cyprus in 2023 is approximately 1.3 million people. Over 100 flights arrive daily into Cyprus. The project is expected to cost â‚¬400 million and will create over 1,000 jobs during construction.

The resort will be located near the Limassol Forest in range of the village of Vasa. It will be an 18-hole championship course designed by Jonathan Gaunt, member of the European Institute of Golf Course Architects(EIGCA). Gaunt is a former professional golfer who turned to golf architecture after his playing career ended. He has a background in property development and has been involved in a number of successful projects in the UK and Europe.

Gaunt believes that the new course will be a major asset to the country and will help to boost the tourism industry. Gaunt is also committed to creating a sustainable development that will benefit the local community.
